result.execSummary:
The defendant Shannon J. Ford was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Kenosha County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.
**   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
Submit a DNA sample (unless previously provided).
** Pay DNA surcharge 
** Pay restitution plus surcharges. State shall have 60 days to determine restitution. May not possess any weapons, including firearms.   Mental Health Treatment.   Meds as prescribed by doctor.

timeConds.notes: AS A CONDITOIN OF PROBATION. Huber allowed.  Credit for 45 days served. Concurrent with 15-CF-245.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney C Lassiter.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Deft pleads guilty.  Court finds deft guilty.  PSI waived.  Court withholds sentence and places deft on probation for 2 years w/conditions consecutive to 12CM1583 & 13CM533; deft to submit DNA sample and pay $250 DNA surcharge; restitution to be determined by DOC w/n 60 days; bond applied to costs/restitution.

With Atty Lassiter the PLEAH of 4/29/15 at 1:30pm is rescheduled, to coincide w/SAR hearings in 12CM1583 and 13CM533, rescheduled to 5/5/15 at 2pm with a backup date of 5/29/15 at 9am, in the event there is another case in trial on 5/5/15.
